title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4209.9 - Fees, Interest, and Administrative Expenses
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4209.9 - Fees, Interest, and Administrative Expenses

State Regulations
(a) Regional corporations shall maintain all
interest earned on funds deposited into a loan fund account in that loan fund
account, and shall use such funds only for the purpose of providing assistance
to eligible projects. (b) Regional
corporations shall deposit all interest earned on working capital loans to
eligible businesses into an interest repayment account. A regional corporation
may use any interest deposited into an interest repayment account for the cost
of administering a regional revolving loan program. (c) A regional corporation may charge
application, commitment, and loan guarantee fees pursuant to a schedule of fees
adopted by the regional corporation and approved by the
corporation. Notes

New

York State Register July 11, 2018/Volume XL, Issue 28, eff. 7/11/2018

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
